intro: Cyrtandra paxiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. Cyrtandra paxiana has small, ovate leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It plays an important role in the ecological balance of its native environment.
